text: Jean Frédéric Joliot-Curie (; né Joliot; 19 March 1900 – 14 August 1958) was a French physicist. He was the husband of Irène Joliot-Curie. Both were given the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1935 for their discovery of artificial radioactivity. He founded with his wife Irène Joliot-Curie the Orsay Faculty of Sciences, part of the Paris-Saclay University. ==References== Category:1900 births Category:1958 deaths Category:French physicists Category:Scientists from Paris
title: Frédéric Joliot-Curie
